description:
Hayate Ayasaki's life wasn't great, but when he loses the job he used to support his good-for-nothing family, and his deadbeat parents sell him to the Yakuza for cash, it really hits rock bottom! Faced with having to pay off the huge debt before he's converted into black market organ parts, a desperate Hayate decides to kidnap oddball heiress Nagi Sanzenin for ransom... but when even that goes wrong and he accidentally ends up rescuing Nagi from other kidnappers, it turns out that Hayate is the bodyguard that Nagi has been looking for! So now he's the Sanzenin family's butler, and… maybe… it might be the start of a potential romantic relationship… assuming Hayate can survive the on-the-job training, of course.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hatakenjiro) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/hajimemashite_maru/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/15184753)

Kenjirou Hata is a Japanese manga author. He is notable for the creation of the series Hayate the Combat Butler. He likes to collect anime related items, such as figurines. He was once an assistant of [Kouji Kumeta](https://anilist.co/staff/97662/Kouji-Kumeta).  

He is married to the voice actress [Masumi Asano](https://anilist.co/staff/95077/Masumi-Asano).

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

[Official Website ](http://www.mami-kawada.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mamikawada) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5MqHx3rECV1BvBBFG3L508?autoplay=true) 

Mami Kawada is a former Japanese pop singer and lyricist who was signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan and also a member of I've Sound, a musical group which produces soundtracks for eroge (erotic games) and anime.

Kawada made her musical debut in 2001 after being discovered by her music teacher [Eiko Shimamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100243/Eiko-Shimamiya) with the release of the song "Kaze to Kimi o Daite". She released her first single, a split-single with musician [KOTOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO), in 2002, and her first solo single was released in 2005. Her first album, Seed, was released in 2006. She first performed overseas in Taiwan in 2007 and later appeared at the Bangkok Comic Con in Thailand in 2014.

Kawada's songs have been featured as theme music for various anime shows such as the Shakugan no Shana and A Certain Magical Index series. She has performed theme songs for various eroge such as Love, Election and Chocolate and Aokana: Four Rhythm Across the Blue. She has also written songs for other musicians. During the LisAni 2016 event, Kawada announced her retirement from singing activities following a final concert in May 2016.

[Official Website ](http://www.mami-kawada.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mamikawada) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5MqHx3rECV1BvBBFG3L508?autoplay=true) 

Mami Kawada is a former Japanese pop singer and lyricist who was signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan and also a member of I've Sound, a musical group which produces soundtracks for eroge (erotic games) and anime.

Kawada made her musical debut in 2001 after being discovered by her music teacher [Eiko Shimamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100243/Eiko-Shimamiya) with the release of the song "Kaze to Kimi o Daite". She released her first single, a split-single with musician [KOTOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO), in 2002, and her first solo single was released in 2005. Her first album, Seed, was released in 2006. She first performed overseas in Taiwan in 2007 and later appeared at the Bangkok Comic Con in Thailand in 2014.

Kawada's songs have been featured as theme music for various anime shows such as the Shakugan no Shana and A Certain Magical Index series. She has performed theme songs for various eroge such as Love, Election and Chocolate and Aokana: Four Rhythm Across the Blue. She has also written songs for other musicians. During the LisAni 2016 event, Kawada announced her retirement from singing activities following a final concert in May 2016.
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.
Senior vocalist for the music group I'VE SOUND.
Senior vocalist for the music group I'VE SOUND.

[Blog ](http://utatsukikaori.blog.fc2.com/) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/05rQduN9R080VjzIiUOX2b?autoplay=true) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/kaoriutatsuki96) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCTQaZaCe1CPyAV9AFeC_DFA)

Kaori Utatsuki is a J-pop singer who is signed to Geneon Universal Entertainment. She is a former member of the music production group [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive). She has performed several songs for eroge together with the other I've Sound members. In August 2007, she released her first maxi single under Geneon Universal Entertainment titled "Shining Stars Bless," which was used as the opening theme for the anime Nanatsuiro Drops.

In 2013, it was announced that Utatsuki will leave I've Sound after the release of her album Going On on March 20, 2013.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~

edges.role: Theme Song Arrangement (OP1, ED1, ED2, ED4)

node.description: __Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.

edges.role: Theme Song Composition (OP1, ED1, ED2, ED4)

node.description: __Kazuya Takase__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and founder of the sound unit I've Sound, which features the so-called "Love Planet Five", which is composed of 5 prolific singers in the Trance/J-pop industry (KOTOKO, Kaori Utatsuki, Eiko Shimamiya, MELL, and Mami Kawada).  Takase acts as a composer and arranger for the themes and OSTs of various anime and eroge games.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/01_chan)

He graduated from Yoyogi Animation school and joined Studio Junio afterwards. After leaving Studio Junio, he became a freelancer and often works with Studio Sunrise and GONZO.
In 2008, him and former GONZO producer Ikeda Touyo founded Encourage Films Co., Ltd, with a capital of 5 million yen.
Ikeda Touyo would serve as the representative director and president of Encourage Films. 
With the death of Ikeda Touyo, on February 17, 2013, he was appointed as the representative director and CEO of Encourage Films.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nakazawa0109)

Tomoyuki Nakazawa is a Japanese composer, arranger and music producer. He is a former member of the music unit I've.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Takashi_Kumazen)__

__Takashi Kumazen__ is a Japanese animator and animation director.
Tsutomu Miyazawa is an animator, storyboard artist, character and mechanical designer formerly affiliated with [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/).
